channel.title: Help With Running
channel.description:
Hello Mopar, I just recently downloaded the 'Second Reality' source and client. When I run the server, I get no errors - but when I try to run the client I get this error:
Registry key 'Software\JavaSoft\Java Runtime Environment\CurrentVersion' has value '1.7', but '1.6' is required. Error: could not find java.dll Error: could not find Java SE Runtime Environment. Press any key to continue . . .
And the code for it looks like this:
@echo off java -Xmx800m -cp .;Theme.jar client pause
Is there any way to fix this? If so, how? Regards, Xevi

item.title: Help With Running
item.dc:creator: @CoderOops CoderOops
item.description:
@CoderOops wrote:

hellomotoboy:

I think it depends on your JDK, if you have an outdated version just download the newest version of JDK.

Does not matter about your JDK … I’m using myself pretty old JDK…
It’s all about leading it to your JDK.

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Running

item.description:
@Xevi wrote:

Hello Mopar,
I just recently downloaded the ‘Second Reality’ source and client. When I run the server, I get no errors - but when I try to run the client I get this error:

Registry key 'Software\JavaSoft\Java Runtime Environment\CurrentVersion' has value '1.7', but '1.6' is required. Error: could not find java.dll Error: could not find Java SE Runtime Environment. Press any key to continue . . .

And the code for it looks like this:

@echo off java -Xmx800m -cp .;Theme.jar client pause

Is there any way to fix this? If so, how?
